thread.title: NFL notes: Bryant's status murky for Giants game - Football
thread.title_full: NFL notes: Bryant's status murky for Giants game - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: NFL notes: Bryant's status murky for Giants game - Football
text:
Dez Bryant’s status will be evaluated all week as the Cowboys decide whether the star receiver can return six weeks after breaking his right foot in the season opener against the Giants.
Buy this photo The Cowboys are growing tired of questions about Dez Bryant, who may — or may not — practice today. Coach Jason Garrett said there was no "Magna Carta" of checkpoints the team was following to determine whether Bryant would return against the Giants on Sunday. 
Garrett wouldn’t say whether Bryant will practice today after he worked on the side for the first time since the injury during last week’s bye. He also declined to say whether the bone was fully healed.
"We are not going to make any determination today as to whether or not Dez Bryant is going to play in this game," Garrett said. "We are going to see how he is doing. He has made a lot of progress in the last two weeks."
SEAHAWKS’ JACKSON CRASHES CAR : Two people with knowledge of the situation say Seahawks running back Fred Jackson was uninjured when his car crashed outside the team’s facility. According to a TMZ.com report, Jackson crashed while in a street race with teammate Marshawn Lynch. A stop sign was knocked over in the wreck.
STEELERS’ JONES TO START: Landry Jones had his first regular-season NFL action last week. Now, it looks as if he will make his first start this week.
Coach Mike Tomlin said his team will prepare for Sunday’s game against the Chiefs as if Jones will be the starting quarterback. Starter Ben Roethlisberger has been out since spraining the medical collateral ligament in his left knee Sept. 27.
BRIEFS: The Seahawks activated fullback Derrick Coleman following his suspension after a car crash that led to his arrest and re-signed center Lemuel Jeanpierre. ... The Browns waived running back Shaun Draughn, who became expendable when Robert Turbin returned from an ankle injury. ... The Jaguars placed kick returner Corey Grant and receiver Tony Washington on injured reserve. ... Bills receiver Marquise Goodwin was placed on the season-ending reserve-injured list, and offensive tackle Jordan Mills was signed off of the Lions practice squad.
